findings.metric: Fraction of tumor proteins represented in immunopeptidome
findings.interpretation: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination was associated with broader antigen display in the immunopeptidome.

findings.metric: Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome
findings.interpretation: The MHC-I-presented peptide landscape expanded substantially after intratumoral mRNA vaccination.

findings.metric: Retrospective human survival comparison p-value under ICI
findings.interpretation: In the retrospective cohort, prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination status was associated with improved survival during ICI treatment.

findings.metric: Type I interferon response score (normalized units)
findings.interpretation: Tumors showed a marked increase in a type I interferon response score following intratumoral mRNA vaccination.

findings.metric: PD-L1 expression fold-change in tumor tissue
findings.interpretation: PD-L1 expression increased, consistent with the checkpoint axis becoming more targetable after vaccination.
Combination therapy was associated with increased CD8+ T-cell infiltration into tumors.

controls_or_null_results.statement: Vaccine-only treatment did not produce durable tumor control in non-immunogenic models.
Lipid particle controls lacking mRNA did not reproduce the sensitization effect.
Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit.
